podcast_details.episode_title: Demetri Martin: A Joke about Safety
podcast_details.episode_transcript: My smoke alarm is so annoying. I hate that that's how safety works, is that they're going to annoy me into being safe. I want to put, like, microwave popcorn around my house. If I wake up in the middle of the night, I'm like, that smells great. I got to get the fuck out of here. Stream Demetri Martin live at the time, only on Netflix.

podcast_summary: The text expresses frustration with a smoke alarm's annoying nature and how it serves the purpose of keeping people safe by being bothersome. The writer suggests a humorous solution of placing microwave popcorn around the house, so the smell would alert them to a potential fire. The mention of waking up in the middle of the night and the desire to leave due to the pleasant popcorn smell seems to be a joke. The text ends with an unrelated advertisement for streaming Demetri Martin's performance exclusively on Netflix.
podcast_highlights:
The highlights of the text are as follows:

- The speaker finds their smoke alarm annoying.
- They express frustration with the fact that safety measures often rely on annoying alerts.
- They humorously suggest using microwave popcorn as a pleasant alert to wake them up in case of danger.
- They mention the humorous idea of waking up to the smell of popcorn and feeling the need to evacuate.
- The text concludes with a playful mention of streaming Demetri Martin's live show on Netflix.
